result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexander Jon Jostad in court.  Attorney John Paul Marchan in court for Alexander Jon Jostad. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Apply cash bail previously posted and refund the balance to the poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:35 PM Defendant Alexander Jon Jostad in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
